episodeTitle: Everyone Finally Has A Bounty! A Pirate Group Worth Over Six Hundred Million!
episodeTitleJapanese: ついに全員賞金首！6億超えの一味！
episodeTitleRomanized: Tsuini Zenin Shōkinkubi! Rokuoku Koe no Ichimi!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates' new ship nears completion as Franky and Iceburg work with the Galley-La foremen. The Franky Family arrives with shocking news: the entire crew now has bounties totaling over 600 million berries. Kokoro warns them about the dangerous Florian Triangle that lies between them and Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Ship Construction Progress Update
events.description: Franky, Iceburg, and the Galley-La foremen work late into the night on the Straw Hat Pirates' new ship. The ship construction is announced to be ahead of schedule and nearing completion.
events.significance: Sets up the imminent completion of the Thousand Sunny and the crew's departure from Water 7.

events.title: Tom's Legacy and Franky's Survival
events.description: Extended flashbacks show Tom, Franky, and Iceburg's relationship as master shipwright and apprentices. The flashback reveals how Franky survived his near-death experience by rebuilding himself with scrap metal, becoming a cyborg.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory about Franky's transformation into a cyborg and his connection to the legendary shipwright Tom, builder of Gol D. Roger's ship.

quotes.text: A man should never regret what he's built!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom's philosophy about shipbuilding and taking responsibility for one's creations

events.title: Usopp's Failed Attempts to Rejoin
events.description: Usopp makes several comedic attempts to get back into the good graces of the Straw Hat crew, trying various scenarios to rejoin. His efforts go unnoticed as Nami closes the curtains.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's desire to rejoin the crew while maintaining his pride, setting up his eventual proper reunion.

events.title: Florian Triangle Introduction
events.description: Kokoro explains that to reach Fish-Man Island, the Straw Hats must traverse the Florian Triangle, a mysterious and dangerous area of the Grand Line where hundreds of ships disappear every year without a trace.
events.significance: First mention of the Florian Triangle, foreshadowing the Thriller Bark arc and introducing one of the Grand Line's most dangerous regions.

quotes.text: Hundreds of ships go missing in the Florian Triangle every year. Some say they vanish without a trace, while others are found adrift with no crew aboard.
quotes.speaker: Kokoro
quotes.context: Warning the Straw Hats about the dangers that lie ahead

events.title: Fish-Man Island Revealed as Grand Line Halfway Point
events.description: The crew learns that Fish-Man Island represents the halfway point of the Grand Line, marking a significant milestone in their journey to find the One Piece.
events.significance: Establishes the scale of the Grand Line and shows how far the Straw Hats have come in their journey.

events.title: Franky Family Delivers the Bounty Posters
events.description: The Franky Family arrives with urgent news, revealing that all members of the Straw Hat Pirates now have bounties from the World Government following the Enies Lobby incident.
events.significance: Marks the World Government's recognition of the entire Straw Hat crew as a serious threat, not just Luffy and Robin.

events.title: Luffy's Bounty Triples to 300 Million
events.description: Luffy's bounty is revealed to have increased from 100 million to 300 million berries, making him one of the most wanted pirates in the world and reflecting his role in declaring war on the World Government at Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Establishes Luffy as a major threat to the World Government and marks a massive increase in his notoriety following Enies Lobby.

quotes.text: Three hundred million berries?! That's amazing!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excited reaction to his new bounty

events.title: Zoro's Bounty Doubles to 120 Million
events.description: Roronoa Zoro's bounty increases from 60 million to 120 million berries, with the epithet 'Pirate Hunter' maintained. This reflects his victories against powerful CP9 agents at Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Confirms Zoro's status as the second-strongest Straw Hat and a major threat to the World Government.

events.title: Robin's Bounty Increases to 80 Million
events.description: Nico Robin's bounty increases slightly from 79 million to 80 million berries, maintaining her 'Devil Child' epithet. Despite being a primary target at Enies Lobby, her bounty increase is modest.
events.significance: Shows Robin remains a high-value target for the World Government due to her ability to read Poneglyphs.

events.title: Sanji's First Bounty: 77 Million
events.description: Sanji receives his first bounty of 77 million berries with the epithet 'Black Leg.' However, his wanted poster features a poorly drawn sketch instead of a photograph, likely due to his involvement with closing Enies Lobby's Gates of Justice.
events.significance: Marks Sanji's official recognition as a wanted pirate, though the drawing instead of a photo becomes a running gag. The bounty amount shows the government recognizes his strength.

events.title: Nami's First Bounty: 16 Million
events.description: Nami receives her first bounty of 16 million berries with the epithet 'Cat Burglar.' Her wanted poster features a clear photograph.
events.significance: Officially recognizes Nami as a wanted pirate and navigator of the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: Usopp's First Bounty as Sogeking: 30 Million
events.description: Usopp receives a bounty of 30 million berries under his Sogeking alias, not his real name. The World Government doesn't realize Sogeking and Usopp are the same person.
events.significance: Shows the World Government recognized Sogeking's role in the Enies Lobby assault, particularly his burning of the government flag. Creates a comedic situation where Usopp is wanted under his alter ego.

events.title: Chopper's Insulting Bounty: 50 Berries
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper receives an insultingly low bounty of only 50 berries with the epithet 'Cotton Candy Lover' (or 'Pet' in some translations). The World Government mistook him for the crew's pet rather than a full crew member.
events.significance: Creates a long-running comedic element where Chopper's strength and role as the crew's doctor are completely unrecognized by the World Government. Despite his contributions at Enies Lobby, he's not seen as a threat.

events.title: Franky's Bounty Revealed: 44 Million
events.description: Franky is revealed to have a bounty of 44 million berries with the epithet 'Cyborg.' This is his first bounty, issued for his involvement in the Enies Lobby incident.
events.significance: Franky's wanted status means he can no longer safely remain in Water 7, pushing him toward joining the Straw Hat Pirates. This sets up his recruitment.

events.title: Franky Family Pleads for Franky to Join the Straw Hats
events.description: The Franky Family members, led by Zambai, plead with Luffy to take Franky with them when they leave. They recognize that Franky's wanted status makes Water 7 too dangerous for him now.
events.significance: The Franky Family shows their loyalty and concern for Franky by asking the Straw Hats to take him. This sets up Franky's eventual recruitment despite his initial reluctance.

events.title: Franky's Initial Refusal to Join
events.description: Despite his wanted status, Franky initially refuses to join the Straw Hat Pirates, expressing loyalty to his family and home in Water 7.
events.significance: Shows Franky's strong ties to Water 7 and the Franky Family, making his eventual decision to join more meaningful.

quotes.text: A man should never regret what he's built!
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom's philosophy about shipbuilding and taking responsibility

quotes.text: Hundreds of ships go missing in the Florian Triangle every year. Some say they vanish without a trace, while others are found adrift with no crew aboard.
quotes.speaker: Kokoro

quotes.text: Three hundred million berries?! That's amazing!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's reaction to his new bounty

themes.description: The episode explores how the Straw Hats' actions at Enies Lobby have made them recognized threats to the World Government. Each crew member now bears the weight of their choices.
themes.symbolism: The bounty posters symbolize both achievement and danger - the crew has grown stronger but now faces greater threats.

themes.description: Through flashbacks to Tom, the episode emphasizes how the teachings and legacy of mentors shape their students. Tom's influence on both Franky and Iceburg is explored.
themes.symbolism: The ship being built represents carrying forward Tom's legacy and dreams.

themes.description: The Franky Family's plea for Franky to leave with the Straw Hats shows the difficult choices between staying with family and pursuing one's dreams.
themes.symbolism: Franky's wanted poster represents the forced choice between his old life and a new adventure.

characterSpotlights.development: Extended flashbacks reveal Franky's past with Tom and how he became a cyborg. His wanted status forces him to confront leaving Water 7.
keyActions: Works on the new ship with Iceburg and Galley-La
Revealed in flashback to have survived his accident by rebuilding himself
Learns he has a bounty of 44 million berries
Initially refuses to join the Straw Hats despite the danger

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's bounty increase to 300 million shows how far he's come and the threat he poses to the World Government.
keyActions: Reacts excitedly to his new bounty
Receives the Franky Family's request to take Franky
quotes: Three hundred million berries?! That's amazing!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper's absurdly low bounty creates comedy while highlighting how the World Government underestimates him.
keyActions: Receives a bounty of only 50 berries
Is mistaken for the crew's pet

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the flashback sequences with Tom, Franky, and Iceburg, providing more detail about their relationship and Franky's transformation into a cyborg than the manga showed in this section.
Episode 320 only adapts pages 10-19 of Chapter 435, with the chapter being spread across multiple episodes (316-320), showing the anime's slower pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time in One Piece that all Straw Hat crew members have bounties simultaneously (though Usopp's is under his Sogeking alias).
The total of all Straw Hat bounties shown in this episode is 667,000,050 berries (300M + 120M + 80M + 77M + 44M + 30M + 16M + 50).
Episode 320 aired on August 19, 2007 in Japan and achieved a TV rating of 9.8%, ranking 5th for that week.
The Florian Triangle is first mentioned in this episode, setting up the mysterious location for the upcoming Thriller Bark arc.
Sanji's wanted poster being a drawing instead of a photo is explained in the next episode (321) - the photographer's lens cap was on during the Enies Lobby incident.
One Piece stopped airing ending songs from episode 279, so episode 320 only features the opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow' with no ending song.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Kazuki Yao voices Franky in the Japanese version in this episode. He would later be replaced by Subaru Kimura in 2025 after voicing the character for 20 years.

sources.title: Franky Voice Actors - Behind The Voice Actors
